> It invalidates the term 'entry point' entirely. If you are allowed to
> b=
ookmark any resource (posts, comments, etc) then any resource is an
> entry=
 point, at which point stating that your blog index is an entry
> point is =
meaningless.

But what=92s the point then of giving those non-entry resourc=
es a URI?

I=92d argue that the definition of =93entry point=94 depends on =
the client.
If the client never visited the blog, the index is the only ent=
ry point.
If it has, then other entry points come available.

Ruben
